intro: Sagraea capillaris, commonly known as the slender sagraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trailing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Sagraea capillaris is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to cascade from hanging baskets or shelves.
